evidence: No convex dependency detected in project

routingPlan.reason: Next.js/React web SDK (@shakenbake/web) with html2canvas, Canvas annotation, keyboard triggers, and React Provider pattern. Web package is core to MVP.
Expo/React Native SDK (@shakenbake/react-native) with shake triggers, react-native-view-shot, @shopify/react-native-skia annotation, and expo-av audio. Development builds required.

Core plugin system (@shakenbake/core) provides shared types, plugin interfaces, and report builder. Linear GraphQL adapter (@shakenbake/linear) handles issue creation. General backend agent recommended for non-specialized work.

ShakeNbake Cloud (apps/cloud) is Next.js App Router with server-side API routes for report ingestion, Whisper transcription, and issue forwarding. Clerk authentication, Postgres/Prisma ORM, Vercel Blob storage, Stripe billing.
Cloud app targets Vercel as reference deployment platform. Multi-package monorepo publish strategy will need Vercel deployment awareness for serverless functions and Blob storage.
Turborepo monorepo coordination, TypeScript base config, shared types (@shakenbake/core), and changesets release workflow. Generic backend agent suitable for build tooling.

notes: ShakeNbake is a pre-code cross-platform bug reporting SDK in specification phase. No mandatory specialist agent gaps detected. Detected specialist agents: frontend-web (Next.js), frontend-native (Expo/React Native), backend (TypeScript/GraphQL), backend-nextjs (Cloud app), deploy-vercel (Vercel deployment). Convex is not applicable (no cloud backend framework). No GitHub integration markers detected; Vercel is the reference deployment platform but CLI availability not confirmed in pre-code phase. Monorepo structure (Turborepo) will coordinate releases across 7 packages: core, react-native, web, linear, cloud-client, cloud app, and examples. Key architectural decisions: Skia for RN annotation (60fps GPU drawing), html2canvas for web screenshots, server-side proxy pattern for Linear API key security, Expo development builds required (no Expo Go). Routing prefers specialists when available: separate agents for frontend-web and frontend-native given the two distinct SDKs and platforms. Backend work is consolidated under a single backend agent (core types, plugin system, Linear adapter). Cloud deployment is specialized (Next.js with Vercel serverless). Recommend specialist agents for frontend-web, frontend-native, backend, backend-nextjs, and deploy-vercel surfaces.
